favourite.article: Tender untold love.
Thank You Lord that Your mercy is so far reaching...even to reach me. Now as the Spirit, continue to do Your perfecting work.
Every time, feel so joyful. thank You God! 久违的感觉，依然还在。
Lord, Thank You for finding us! You gave Your all to come find us!
amen!!!
Gospel theme never getting old. Lord Jesus we love You.
This is absolutely my favorite.
Amen.
I'm in the comments too!

I do enjoy this sweet, the Triune God's love and care expounding hymn. We do need to speak the high peak truth, which indeed being the deep truth. 'Deep' implies it is able to touch 'my deepest parts', that is our spirit along with our mind, emotions, will. I like that this hymn does it in simple, story-telling way. Could you ever leverage/appy the Luke 15 parables to believers' experience? 'Your tender loving care', 'sweeping in my deepest parts', 'eagerly awaiting me', 'fell upon my neck'. Each believer, I think, is tired of ourward things, vanity and seeks for the reality, the deep touch with the Father, Son and Spirit as the cosummate Spirit in them. May Lord bring us on for the deeper experiencing Him, this hymn being the means for believers to apprehend and enter into our dear processed and consummated Triune God. As I was writing this comment I felt to recommend this hymn to one of my Christian friends.

I'm really enjoying stanza 5. My life indeed has been a wreck. These past weeks I have been squandering my time seeking after worldly love, pleasure, and vain things of emptiness. Eventually, all these things have led to nothing. Even among the worldliest people, I am considered a vulgar failure. But although I am the worst, the Lord still ran to me after the slightest turn. Hallelujah for His love and grace!
I have just came back from the year 7 conference and this song really touched my heart and while I was there I received the Lord Jesus.

Sat in a quiet time this morning and let the sweetness of these words wash over my being. Thank You Triune God for Your determined stubborn love toward each of us. You sought us, called us by name, carried us, saved us by putting us into the church life.
Coming out of the denominations and into the church life floored me, that such a way to meet exists in the earth! Oh, a way to love and pursue our Triune God together. No one knows how lonely and lost I was in a crowded denomination! I did not know God's eternal purpose, I ran around trying to find "my ministry or my gift" and missed knowing this wonderful Christ. Lord have mercy, but I did not even know my regenerated mingled spirit!
WHAT A RESCUING! To be brought to be with the saints, I am not alone anymore. I don't have to try and figure anything out anymore. And its beautiful because we all know that we are weak and full of shortages, but Hallelujah! We have the Lord and each other. We flee, we pursue, we call together. The Lord would complete the good work in us as His one Body.
Lord Jesus, thank You for bringing us all together, for building us into You, and You into us. What a gospel today! Hallelujah.

This is one of the songs that I love the most because it reflects the true love which is our Lord's true love! "Left the ninety-nine behind You searched until the lost sheep You did find, Laid me on Your shoulders there, You bore me in Your tender loving care" I love You Lord :)

Every time I sing this song, I always declare the 3rd or 4th verse. Amen Lord! Even though we were the last and lost sheep, you came to find us! Oh Lord! You exposed me of my sin! Praise the Lord! You sprinkled me with the blood You shed for me!
Amen, we currently sang this song at SSOT at Engedi camp. It was so enjoyable. PRAISE THE LORD!
I love this song. I always thought the gospel ended at going to heaven. But praise the Lord I found the church in Arcadia and the saints shined in me there is much more to that!

This song ministers a lot to me and since have heard it l am so addicted to it and it brings joy to my heart each time l listen to it (l do not know how to sing it very well yet) and there is a new meaning. God's love and affection is so deep to me l can't just comprehend it.

This really touched me: "Sweeping in my deepest parts, You lit a lamp and searched my inward heart, Sanctifying deep within You shined in me, Exposed me of my sin; Repenting—now I see Lord, You're sprinkling me—with the blood You shed for me."

Oh Lord, thank You that You searched and find me. You laid me in Your shoulders and bore me in Your tender loving care. How much I thank You for Your saving strength and saving love. I am a small sheep and You gave all to come find me. I love You Lord.
I love the gospel. It's the only hope to a hopeless and dying world.....
This song reminds me of the West African Young Peoples' Conference, 2006 in Accra.Thank the Lord for His unconditional love. Jesus Christ is Lord.

I love this song because it shows the all-inclusiveness of Christ, His never failing love and how He has accepted us as His own...Hallelujah for the Body.....O Lord Jesus thank You for mingling Your spirit with ours...I love You Lord Jesus.
Amen, thank You Lord! You gave all to come find me! :)
AMEN!! This is my favourite hymn :D we sing it in the young people meetings.
This song shows the all-inclusive Triune God! It shows Him as the Spirit, the Son, and the Father! Praise the Lord for His love! Hallelujah!
This hymn is very special. To all those who sang it and to those who know the significance of Luke 15, I know it's undeniable how this hymn is. Amen!
This song is unforgetable. The tune and the words are both dear to me.
The Lord has so much mercy on us. It's just amazing how He is just waiting for us. He is in our deepest parts!!!!
Thanks to God for the gift of Christ. He is the gospel. I love this gospel song. It reminds me of the One who is eager to receive me back.
I really like this song because it really shows how much mercy we have from the Lord, for knowing the truth and the way. But the gospel is to me the Truine God within humanity!
Praise the Triune God-Man Savior! He is saving us right now to the uttermost.
JUBILEE!!! Praise the Lord He is our Jubilee! We have been returned to our possession and our family!!
This song shows that some of the religions promise things that aren't equal to the Lord. Praise the Lord!

This is the first time hearing the song on Hymnal.net and I just love it. I just feel like telling all the young people in the Church in NYC. This song has just brought me back to God's sweet will for us. People always feel the Bible only pertains to what was going on in that time it was return. But we, the Church, know that the Lord is moving today.
O LORD JESUS! Saints, stanza one says, "There's a gospel of today that says believe! And be saved!" It doesn't stop there because in the same stanza it says it "fails to treat all the vanity that is hidden in me". The first stanza is concerning Christianity today. But the second stanza is concerning the Lord's Recovery. Being the Triune God, all of God's fulness as the Spirit within us, reaching the saints, making His home in our hearts, and spreading into our souls and very being. Becoming "the one reality". Experiencing His love untold.
This song was the first song I ever sang when I got into the church life, and the song that saved me.

The lyrics of this song are so true. For a long time this is the Gospel I believed and tried so HARD to be excited about it. All the preachers were excited, but I felt so left out. Then I realize this is PART of the Gospel. The Gospel is God becoming man to save me, then becoming the life-giving Spirit (1 Cor 15:45) to enter into me and give me all He accomplished on Calvary and His divine life!
I like this song. I am so happy that I made it as a young person in the Lord's recovery. At school, there are too many unbelievers. We need to preach that THERE'S A GOSPEL TODAY.

This song is one of my favorites because no matter what my day or my life has been like He is always eagerly awaiting. I'm 18 and I was the only one at my school who was in the church life and I felt blessed. I look at the lives of my friends and classmates around me and I'm always thankful that i made it.
It speaks peace and rest to me from a wonderful Person.
